name: Global Okta Setup
title: Global Okta Setup
body:
Overview

This guide provides a comprehensive step-by-step process for setting up and customizing Okta for Tivian. It focuses on global configurations that are set once and applied across all users and tenants, including email setup, login page customization, Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) enablement, and Okta profile adaptations.

  • Initial email setup
  • Add general customization and custom domain
  • Customizing of the login page
  • Enable Factors for Multi Factor Authentication
  • Adapt Okta profiles
  • Ask support to enable disabling the security question

Initial User Setup

  • Create internal groups

  • Add initial users

  • Give initial users admin rights

 

Create the following groups (also see Group Setup):

  • tivian super admins

  • tivian access installers

  • tivian user managers

 

Add users that will be super admins later on by creating them locally in Okta:

Assign admin rights.

Assign admin rights to the specific groups so that the specified users can get appropriate access rights. To to that navigate to Security → Administrators → Add Administrator Group.

 

Create an account for the API user and assign the following access rights to that user on the administrator page:

  • Organization Administrator

  • API Access Management Administrator

  • Application Administrator (for all applications)

Disable noreply

The noreply user has a special meaning in EFS. It should not be possible to add such a user to Okta. Therefore add it upfront and disable it.

  • create a user with the address “noreply@questback.com” (“noreply@tivian.com”)

  • disable the user

  • give a hint that this user has to stay disabled

 

Initial email setup

Navigate to Security → General and disable all emails in the “security Notifications Emails.

  • New sign on notification mail → Disabled

  • MFA enrolled notification email → Disabled

  • MFA reset notification email → Disabled

  • Report suspicious activity via email → disabled

 

Customize Email templates:

  • Add custom HTML code to the following templates: UserActivation, Forgot Password Denied, Password Reset By Admin, Forgot Password

  • Use HTML code from https://bitbucket.org/qbengineering/okta_resource_email_customization/src/master/ (press “edit” to create the first customization)

  • Check if HTML looks okay

 

Add general customization and custom domain

  • Personal information and passwords will be stored in Okta

  • Secondary Email is enabled and Security Image disabled

  • Opt out of Okta Communication

  • Edit the custom URL (see below)

  • Enable JIT

  • Send user to custom URL in “Default App for Sign-In Widget” - URL will be https://pm.customervoice360.com/uc/signup_confirm/ (temporarily - working on something better)

Customizing of the login page

  • Change theme, logo and background image of the login/error screens as well as footer

  • Disable security image

  • Opt out of Okta user communication for the current organization

  • Add neccessary labels

  • Add login and error page customizations

Custom Domain

This has to be done in sync with IT-OPs

  • Create a TXT record and verify it - continue if that is green

  • Create the DNS record

  • Get a certificate for Okta and add certificate, key and certificate chain

  • Add the CNAME

 

Change logo and background image

Navigate to: Settings → Appearance

The images could be found in the following git repository: https://bitbucket.org/qbengineering/okta_resource_login_customization/src/master/assets/

 

Add custom login page

  • Change Custom Sign In, Custom Error Pages

  • Use code from https://bitbucket.org/qbengineering/okta_resource_login_customization/src/master/ (paste production code in the editor window of okta)

 

Enable Factors for Multi Factor Authentication

Navigate to: Security → Multifactor

Only “Okta Verify” and “Google Authenticator” will be enabled for now. This might change in future. Okta Verify should be require TouchID.

Adapt Okta profiles

Currently EFS will store the email domain of the user in a separate field. If a user gets synced to Okta this field will be stored. It has to be created before any user gets synced to Okta.

Navigate to: Directory → Profile Editor → Choose Profile “user” - “User”

 

Navigate to the “Profile” option of that user profile.

 

Add a new user attribute by clicking “Add Attribute”.

 

Create an attribute for the email domain:

Values:

Data Type: string

Display name: Email Domain

Variable name: email_domain

Description: Something meaningful

Attribute Length: between 1 and 255

 

 

Ask support to enable disabling the security question

The Okta support can enable that the security question can be disabled in the options.

  • Ask the support to enable this option

  • Disable the security question in the password policies (Security → Authentication)
